conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model: extruded walls with thickness, visible interior volumes, and an elevated/isometric-like camera with roof removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and readable room volumes; angled view is correct; cutaway is clean. Minor simplification of wall top edges/joins and some openings/partitions appear generalized.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room set and adjacency largely match (kitchen/dining-left, living-center, two bedrooms-right, bath-center/bottom, laundry-left). Some proportional drift in hall/bath/closet partitioning and a few internal wall lengths/placements appear shifted compared to the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture and program elements are present (dining table, sofa/TV, beds, kitchen counters, laundry machines, bathroom vanity/tub). Some items are simplified and a few placements/orientations do not strongly evidence the exact room boundaries from the 2D plan.

visual_clarity.notes: Walls/floors/openings are clearly distinguishable with clean rendering and neutral background; interior visibility is good. Minor ambiguity from similar materials and simplified door/window detailing.

detected_errors.description: Noticeable proportional/partition deviations in the central hall/bath/closet zone versus the 2D plan (some internal wall positions and lengths appear generalized).
Door/opening configuration is simplified; not all door placements/swing locations from the 2D plan are clearly represented in the 3D model.
Furniture is mostly correct but simplified; some pieces do not strongly confirm exact room extents or may be slightly misoriented relative to the 2D layout.

summary: A clear and valid 3D cutaway conversion with strong overall layout correspondence, but with some notable simplification and proportional drift in internal partitions and door/opening details.
